definition: to fire/to sack/to dismiss/to terminate employment
relations between labor and employer/industrial relations
gherao (from Hindi, SE Asian method of protest)

sentences.english: Although the farm is large, my Dad has two men working for him.
sentences.chinese: 尽管农场较大，我爸爸只雇了两个人帮他干活。

sentences.english: She hired a detective to shadow her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了私家侦探盯梢她丈夫。

sentences.english: The Chicago Bull bought a new guard.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥公牛队新雇了一名后卫。

sentences.english: Easton suggested that a special saloon carriage should be engaged.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯顿建议雇一辆专用客车。

sentences.english: He put forward a gallant proposal.
And he replied by saying, "We hire the very best auditors."
sentences.chinese: 他对此并没有回答“我公司雇有最好的审计师们”。

sentences.english: He wanted to scab me, but I refused.
sentences.chinese: 他想雇我破坏罢工，被我拒绝了。

sentences.english: Business was good enough to hire a helper.
sentences.chinese: 生意红火，还雇了个帮工。

sentences.english: Jubilantly, he decided to hire a maid to relieve his wife from her domestic tasks.
sentences.chinese: 高兴之余，他雇了一个女佣来减轻妻子做家务的负担。

sentences.english: I saved money by not paying a trainer whether I went to the gym or not.
sentences.chinese: 无论去不去健身房，我都省下了雇教练的钱。

sentences.english: A lady employed a maid-servant being very stupid.
sentences.chinese: 一位太太雇了一个愚蠢的女仆。

sentences.english: I've hired an hourly worker to help me clean my kitchen once a week.
sentences.chinese: 我雇了一个小时工，每星期来帮我打扫一次厨房。
公司雇有几个自由撰稿人。

sentences.english: I hire a public relations person to publicize the fact that I work from home. P. 7
sentences.chinese: 我雇了一名公关人员，向公众宣布，我是在家工作的。

sentences.english: Hire a PGA instructor for a series of golf lessons for you and dad.
sentences.chinese: 雇一名职业教练为你和老爸上上高尔夫课。

definition: to help with farm work/casual laborer
bitter work/hard toil/(loanword) coolie, unskilled Chinese laborer in colonial times
